conclusion: To determine the distance fallen, analyze the area under the velocity-time graph for the interval.
Velocity increases from 0 m/s at t = 0 s to approximately 20 m/s at t = 10 s; curve is smooth.
If velocity increased linearly, the area under the graph would form a right triangle with area 100 m.
The actual curve rises more gradually initially and steepens towards the end.
Since the curve is concave up, the area under the curve is less than the area of the triangle.
The distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is less than 100 meters.
